. Pronounced "Gurnville", the town is known for environmental and gay activism as well as its beautiful redwood forested riverside site.

value: The nearest large airport is in
From San Francisco, follow Highway 101 North to the "River Road" exit just past
. Turn left at the traffic signal. Guerneville is 16 miles west.
The closest airport is Charles M. Schultz Sonoma County with nonstop service to/from Seattle, Los Angeles, and Portland(starts Oct 28, 2007)

Having a car is important. You can get to Guerneville using public transportation, however is not easy or convenient. Once you are at 'the River' (as it is also known) having a car will help you explore the stunningly beautiful countryside. There are bicycle rentals available in town (seasonally), but much of the terrain is very hilly and the roads are narrow without much of a shoulder for getting well out of traffic.

value: 5 Seasons River Village Resort and Spa

a luxurious warm water, wet marine salts and essential oils spa treatment for being reborn. Facials, pediSpa, therapeutic massage and more.
content=Visitor center, large outdoor amphitheater, self-guided nature trails from 1 to 9 miles long, and a variety of picnic facilities among towering redwoods.
directions=North on Armstrong Woods to firestation, Right on Woodland Drive, at Buttner Street turn left into Resort Driveway

content=Spend the day eliminating those pesky tan lines. Nude sunbathing at the pool available for small fee all year long! Mostly Gay/Lesbian resort is 'straight-friendly'. Day Use includes use of the pool, bbq, tv lounge & grounds (only clothing optional at the pool). No restaurant or bar, bring a picnic and enjoy!

content=Unique art gallery featuring fine art from local and regional artists; rotating exhibits include paintings, sculpture, glass mosaics; and jewelry. Prices generally range from under $50 up to $1500.
content=13555 Highway 116. Upscale, a la carte, entrees $22-$32.
content=Home of the most delicious turkey burger in the Bay Area!
content=Change of ownership has the swedish pancakes being prepared in a more traditional manner. Still good food.
content=Offers an entertaining and educational tour of its champagne cellars. Champagne tasting is free after the tour, and a gourmet deli offers good choices for a lunch under the redwoods.
content=Three of their own, plus some other local brews.
5 Seasons River Village Resort and Spa
]14880 River Road, Guerneville, California, USA 95446.  tel: +1 707 869-8139  (fax: +1 707 869-3096. email: mailto:info@5seasonsresorts.com) Open year round. A full service spa destination.  Home of
a luxurious warm water, wet marine salts and essential oils spa treatment for being reborn.  Resort consists of onsite cottages
priced from ($99) to luxury eco-friendly vacation homes
in the surrounding area ($300+).  Your well behaved pet is welcome.  Proud to be an eco-friendly resort.
content= A variety of nice accommodations.

content=Individual Cabins with fireplaces - some with kitchens or oversized soaking tubs, and all with private porches. Peaceful gay and lesbian (straight-friendly) retreat. Most cabins recently remodeled. Clothing optional sunbathing at pool. Seasonal camping. Massage Therapist available for outdoor massage in a grove of redwood trees (weather permitting) or indoors. Three pet-friendly cabins. 2 blocks to town.

content=Updated studios all have one queen bed and a full kitchen. Close to downtown for shopping and restaaurants, great location near hiking, wine tasting, and summer water sports. Great for a weekend or a week.
